headline: 68% of Catholic Women Ignore Birth Control Rule, Study Shows
snippet: A "dramatic change" has taken place in the birth control practices of Roman Catholic women in the United States, with more than two-thirds of married Catholics now using contraceptive methods disapproved by the church, the latest findings of the 1970...

headline: TRENTON WARNS FINANCIAL GROUPS; Querying Mortgage Seekers on Birth Control Barred
snippet: TRENTON, Dec. 18 -- The State Banking Department warned New Jersey financial institutions today that they had no business asking prospective home buyers if they practiced birth control when deciding whether to grant couples a mortgage loan.

headline: Advocate of Birth Control Wins Dismissal of Charge
snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 -- An Arlington, Va., County court dismissed today a disorderly conduct charge against William R. Baird, the birth control advocate, stemming from a proabortion demonstration during a national conference of Roman Catholic bishops...

headline: Lending Groups Cautioned On Birth Control Questions; Home Buyers' Practices Their Own Business, Bank Unit Says
snippet: TRENTON, Dec. 18 -- The State Banking Department warned New Jersey financial institutions today that they had no business asking prospective home buyers if they practiced birth control when deciding whether to grant couples a mortgage loan.

headline: BRITISH SET PLAN ON BIRTH CONTROL; Those in 'Special' Need to Get Free Contraceptives
snippet: LONDON, Nov. 12 -- Britain is to extend family planning services to include free contraceptives for all "with special social or financial needs."

headline: Hugh Moore, Industrialist, Dies; Birth. Control Crusader Was 85
GHANA GIVES GIFTS FOR BIRTH CONTROL
snippet: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Aug. 5 (Reuters) -- Housewives in rural Ghana are being offered free cans of powdered milk as an incentive to use contraceptives and help keep the birth rate down, a United Nations seminar was told here.

headline: Birth Control Study Says Many Rely on Unimproved Methods
snippet: WASHINGTON, June 5 -- Despite the rapid spread of sophosticated methods, a quarter of all women who want to limit the size of their families still rely on less effective means of contraception, according to a major family planning study published...

headline: Abortion, Birth Control and an Ignored Issue: Ethics
snippet: The lack of any discussion about the ethical implications of the Rockefeller Commission's recommendations concerning abortion, sterilization and the disseminating of contraceptives to all individuals, regardless of age, is disturbing to those of us...

headline: Birth Control: Peking Could Teach Us
snippet: Your May 26 editorial "One Billion Chinese" is guilty of unwarranted, though probably unwitting, condescension in suggesting, after an obeisance to "two-way exchange of data," that "all nations have a stake in helping to make information available to...

headline: Georgia Called Leader In Aid to Birth Control
snippet: US HEW Dept calls Ga's family-planning program most popular in US; Ga ranks 1st among states in participation, with 50,000 eligible women receiving free birth control supplies; program is aimed primarily at women aged 15 through 44 whose family...

headline: A Job for The Birth Control Teams; China's People:
snippet: A girl on her way to work steps briskly from her Shanghai apartment, pokes her head in a door down the street and says, "mark me down for today!" then continues on.

headline: India Will Investigate Pill For Birth Control Program
snippet: Indian Govt appts com to rept on efficacy and safety of oral contraceptive before recommending its use for mass population control program

headline: Mrs. Louis Moore, 79, Dead; Led Birth Control League
Moslems Back Birth Control
snippet: 1st Islamic conf on family planning, organized by Internatl Planned Parenthood Fed, rules that birth control is permissible in Moslem law but that sterilization is prohibited
